column3: str

Concern is writ plain upon Vuyargur's face.

※Please note that the difficulty of this quest has been synced to your current level. Furthermore, you may not proceed with a class or job that is different from when you accepted this quest.
Speak with the Yok Huy supply runner at Icuvlo's Inn.
Speak with Vuyargur.
<Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>, I have a favor to ask of you. I had sent someone to Icuvlo's Inn to replenish our larder, but she is rather late to return.
I fear she may have encountered some manner of trouble on the road. I would be grateful if you could search for her.
Oh dear, Vuyargur asked you to find me? I'm so sorry, I didn't mean to make him worry.
I'd heard that a feast was to be held for the snow spirits, you see, and I wanted to serve up something that they might enjoy with the kirkahryar.
But I couldn't think of anything, and the time got away... Would you happen to have any ideas?
I wanted to provide a treat for the spirits again─something different and new. But I couldn't think of anything, and the time got away... Would you happen to have any ideas?
What will you say?
How about another variety of liquor?
How about sweets prepared with ice?
There's no knowing the spirits' tastes.
Ah, so something that offers contrast. In which case, the Pelupelu's mezcal may be suitable.
The taste is rather different from kirkahryar, but perhaps some snow spirits will enjoy it.
Ah, of course, it stands to reason that snow spirits would prefer cold things.
In which case, perhaps I could freeze some flowers and fruits in a bed of ice. That would be both pretty and palatable, I daresay.
It's true, there's still much that we don't know about the spirits... That's why I spent so much time pondering it to no avail.
Perhaps by simply enjoying the occasion ourselves, we would make it more enjoyable for them. In which case, something that we ourselves like would be suitable.
Yes, the more I think on it, the more I feel confident in that approach. It will make for a wonderful banquet, I'm sure of it!
I'm much obliged for your guidance. Please assure Vuyargur that I'll be back as soon as I have what I need.
My thanks again for your guidance, and please assure Vuyargur that I'll be back as soon as I have what I need.
Were you able to find the supply runner?
So that is the way of it... I'm glad to hear that she was safe.
And thanks to your sage counsel, she was able to arrive at an answer to her dilemma. I shall look forward to seeing what she acquires for the snow spirits.
